home.title: Home

corpus.title: Corpus Management
corpus.name: Name
corpus.author: Author
corpus.deleteCorpusConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"?
corpus.deleteCorpusWarning: This will delete all texts and annotations in this corpus.
corpus.deleteTextConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{{filename}}"?
corpus.noTextsToAnnotate: No texts or transcripts to annotate
corpus.spacyForceHint: Some texts already annotated were skipped. Click "Re-annotate" to overwrite existing annotations
corpus.customTextTypePlaceholder: e.g., Poetry Collection, Script, Product Manual
corpus.transcriptNotAvailable: Transcript not available. The file may still be processing or transcription was not enabled.

edit.title: Edit Corpus Text
edit.entityExtractInfo: Select entity types to extract and remove from text. Extracted entities will be shown below for easy copying.
edit.normalizeInfo: Select text normalization options to clean up special characters and formatting issues.
edit.unicodeNormalizeDesc: Normalize text to NFKC form, unify full-width/half-width characters
edit.whitespaceNormalizeDesc: Merge multiple spaces into one, trim leading/trailing whitespace, preserve line breaks
edit.removeLineBreaksDesc: Merge multiple consecutive line breaks into a single one
edit.removeSpecialCharsDesc: Keep only letters, numbers, Chinese, and basic punctuation
edit.removeHtmlDesc: Remove all HTML tags, keep only plain text content
edit.removeControlCharsDesc: Remove invisible control characters (except newlines and tabs)

batchEdit.title: Batch Edit
batchEdit.findReplaceInfo: Find/Replace will be applied to all selected text files
batchEdit.entityExtractInfo: Entity extraction will be applied to all selected text files
batchEdit.normalizeInfo: Text normalization will be applied to all selected text files

corpus.fullAnnotating: Full annotation in progress (SpaCy + USAS + MIPVU)...
corpus.clipReAnnotateDesc: Select classification labels and set frame interval. CLIP will perform semantic classification on video frames.
corpus.clipFrameIntervalDesc: Set how many frames between each CLIP classification. Smaller values produce more detailed annotations but take longer to process.
corpus.frameIntervalHelper: Default 30 frames, set to 1 for frame-by-frame annotation

search.title: Search Configuration
search.wordDesc: Count word forms as they appear in text
search.lemmaDesc: Count lemmas (base forms) using SpaCy annotation
search.wordlistHelp: Enter one word per line to match only these words
search.removeStopwordsHelp: Remove common stopwords based on corpus language (NLTK)
search.excludeWordsPlaceholder: One word per line to exclude...
search.excludeWordsHelp: Enter words to exclude, one per line

search.title: Search Configuration
search.searchQueryHelp: Leave empty to analyze all words

posFilter.keepModeDesc: Only keep words with selected POS tags

ngram.nestNgramDesc: Group shorter N-grams as subsets of longer N-grams

posFilter.title: POS Filter
posFilter.keepModeDesc: Keep only words with selected POS tags
posFilter.filterModeDesc: Filter out words with selected POS tags
posFilter.allWordsMatch: All words in N-gram must match the POS filter

search.title: Search Configuration
search.maxFrequencyHint: Set max frequency to 0 for unlimited
search.minWordLengthDesc: Minimum characters for each word in N-gram
search.typeContainsWordDesc: N-gram contains the input as a complete word
search.typeWordlistDesc: N-gram contains any word from the list
search.excludeWordsDesc: N-grams containing these words will be excluded
search.excludeWordsPlaceholder: One word per line to exclude...
search.lowercaseDesc: Convert all text to lowercase before analysis

search.title: Search Configuration
search.simpleDesc: Match words or lemmas. Use * for any chars, ? for one char, | for alternatives, -- for hyphen variants.
search.simplePlaceholder: Enter search word... (e.g., m*, ???t, return|go back)
search.lemmaDesc: Find all word forms of a lemma. Supports regular expressions.
search.phraseDesc: Find exact multi-word phrase. Supports regular expressions.
search.wordDesc: Find exact word form. Supports regular expressions.
search.cqlDesc: Corpus Query Language for complex searches.
search.wildcardHelp: Wildcards: * any chars | ? one char | word1|word2 for OR | multi--billion for hyphen variants

posFilter.title: POS Filter
posFilter.allPartsMatch: All words in search results must match the POS filter

cqlBuilder.title: CQL Builder
cqlBuilder.normalTokenDesc: Define a specific word or lemma
cqlBuilder.tip: Tip: Click on element cards to select, then edit or delete. Use "Distance" element to specify gaps between tokens.
cqlBuilder.regexTip: Tip: Use regex for pattern matching, e.g., ".*ing" matches all words ending in -ing

sort.title: Sort Settings
sort.retrogradeHelp: Sort by last character first, useful for grouping words by endings

wordsketch.title: Word Sketch
wordsketch.diffDescription: Enter two words to compare their collocation patterns

viz.runAnalysisFirst: Run Word Sketch analysis first to see visualization
viz.runDiffFirst: Run Sketch Difference analysis first to see visualization

annotation.clickLabelToSelect: Click label to select for annotation

annotation.selectLabelFirstToSearch: Please select a label first to search
annotation.deleteArchiveConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete archive "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.
annotation.confirmDeleteArchive: Are you sure you want to delete archive
annotation.coderNameHelper: Used to identify different coders in inter-coder reliability analysis
annotation.historyDescription: View and manage all corpus annotation archives
annotation.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this archive? This action cannot be undone.
annotation.selectTextOrArchive: Select a text file or load an archive to start annotation
annotation.selectMediaOrArchive: Select a video or audio file or load an archive to start annotation
annotation.timelineTip: Tip: Each line segment represents the duration of an annotation. You can drag, zoom, and hover to view details
annotation.circularTip: Left: YOLO Detection | Right: Manual Annotation | Bar length = count
annotation.noVideoAnnotations: No video annotations (YOLO detection or manual annotation)
annotation.label: Label
annotation.sunburstChartTip: Tip: Click sectors to zoom in, click center to go back
annotation.scatterChartTip: Tip: Bars show YOLO/Manual annotation time spans. Hover for details
annotation.scatterChartTipWithClip: Tip: Bars show YOLO/Manual annotation time spans. Light line background shows CLIP label confidence changes
annotation.selectLabelForBatch: Please select a label first for batch annotation
annotation.autoAnnotateDisabled: Current framework does not support auto-annotation
annotation.autoAnnotateNotSupportedForMedia: Auto-annotation not supported for audio/video transcripts
annotation.mipvuDataNotFound: MIPVU annotation data not found. Please upload or re-annotate first
annotation.spacyDataNotFound: SpaCy annotation data not found. Please upload or re-annotate first
annotation.alignmentNotAvailable: Waveform alignment not available. Click to process forced alignment and pitch extraction for this audio.
annotation.noAudioVisualizationData: No audio annotation data to visualize
annotation.audioVisualizationTip: Hover for details, scroll to view full timeline
annotation.chineseAudioHint: Chinese audio should be annotated in plain text mode
annotation.drawBoxMode: Draw box annotation (select a label first)
annotation.noAudioBoxData: No audio box data available for chart generation
annotation.svgVisualizationTip: Use scrollbar to view full timeline, Ctrl+Scroll to zoom
annotation.noSavedVisualization: No saved visualization data. Please re-save the archive to generate visualization.

framework.label: Label
framework.tierNameHint: Tier names will be automatically converted to uppercase
framework.labelNameHint: Label names keep original case, spaces convert to hyphens
framework.definitionPlaceholder: Optional: Enter node definition or description
framework.nameChangeHint: Changing name will also update the filename
framework.customCategoryHint: Enter a new category name, can be reused after creation
framework.noChildren: No children yet, add from the right panel

reliability.title: Inter-Coder Reliability Analysis
reliability.description: Upload annotation results from multiple coders, calculate inter-coder reliability coefficients, and evaluate annotation consistency.
reliability.validateFirst: Please validate data first before configuring calculation parameters
reliability.exactMatchDesc: Annotations must be exactly the same
reliability.noResults: No results yet, please configure parameters and run calculation
reliability.kwicDescription: Click a row to view annotation details from each coder
reliability.clickRowToExpand: Click row to view coder annotations
reliability.label: Label
reliability.helpItem2: Files should contain the same text
reliability.goldStandardHelp1: Select one archive as gold standard
reliability.tooltipPA: Average percent agreement across all coder pairs with individual pair details
reliability.tooltipFK: Multi-coder reliability measure showing observed and expected agreement
reliability.tooltipCK: Average Cohen's Kappa across all coder pairs with individual pair details
reliability.tooltipKA: Universal reliability measure suitable for various data types and coder numbers
reliability.tooltipRP: Requires selecting a gold standard/ground truth. Recall = correct annotations / total gold standard, Precision = correct annotations / total coder annotations.
reliability.krippendorffReference: These figures are drawn from Krippendorff (2007, case C.)
reliability.goldStandardTooltip: Select an archive as gold standard to additionally calculate recall and precision.
reliability.goldStandardHint: Optional: Click the radio button on the right of the file to set it as gold standard for recall and precision calculation
reliability.videoAudioNotSupported: Video/audio archives not supported. Please upload plain text annotation archives
reliability.textOnlyNote: Note: Inter-coder reliability analysis only supports plain text annotation archives

preprocess.title: Text Chunking
preprocess.chunkingHelp: SBERT supports up to 512 tokens. When enabled, long texts will be split by paragraphs and sentence boundaries
preprocess.chunkingDisabledHelp: When disabled, preserves original document segmentation; each source paragraph/text is treated as an independent document unit
preprocess.chunkingLogicHelp: Paragraphs smaller than min tokens will be merged forward, then re-split by sentence boundaries
preprocess.chunkExceedsLimit: Chunk exceeds {{limit}} token limit (actual: {{actualTokens}}). Please reduce the max tokens setting.
preprocess.sentenceExceedsLimit: A sentence exceeds {{limit}} token limit (actual: {{actualTokens}} tokens). Please manually split long sentences in your source text.

vectorizer.stopwordsHelp: Remove stopwords during vectorization to extract more meaningful topic words
vectorizer.stopwordsAutoHelp: Stopwords language is automatically selected based on corpus metadata

embedding.title: Text Embedding
embedding.noEmbeddings: No embedding files for this corpus
embedding.modelNotFound: Model not found, please ensure model files exist
embedding.nameHelp: Use only letters, numbers, underscore and hyphen

analysis.title: BERTopic Analysis
analysis.selectEmbeddingFirst: Please select an embedding file first

representation.info: Representation models improve how topic keywords are extracted
representation.candidateTopicsHint: Comma-separated topics, e.g. tech, sports, finance
representation.posPatternInfo: Extract topic words using POS patterns, default: NOUN, ADJ+NOUN
representation.ollamaWarning: Please connect to Ollama in settings to use this feature

results.title: Results
results.estimateOutliersHelp: Estimate outlier count changes based on strategy and threshold without modifying actual results
results.thresholdHelp: Threshold range 0-1, higher values keep fewer outliers
results.mergeTopicsHelp: Select at least 2 topics to merge. Merged topics will be combined into one, and original topics will be removed.
results.editLabelHelp: Set a custom label for this topic. The label will be displayed on topic cards and visualizations.
results.customLabelNote: Using 'Generate Topic Names' will overwrite all custom labels

visualization.title: Visualization
visualization.enableDynamicTopics: Enable dynamic topic analysis to see topics over time

dynamicTopic.title: Dynamic Topic Analysis
dynamicTopic.nrBinsHelp: Leave empty to auto-determine time bins
dynamicTopic.noDateData: No texts with date metadata in corpus

lda.title: LDA Topic Modeling
lda.info: LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation) discovers abstract topics in document collections
lda.optimizeDesc: Test different topic numbers to find the optimal value based on perplexity and coherence.
lda.optimizeProgress: Testing different topic numbers. This may take a while.

params.title: LDA Parameters
params.customAlphaDesc: Enter {{count}} alpha values (one for each topic), separated by commas. Higher values make documents more likely to be assigned to that topic.
params.customAlphaSliderDesc: Adjust alpha for each topic. Higher values increase the probability of documents being assigned to that topic.

results.noResults: No results yet. Run LDA analysis to see topics.

viz.noData: No visualization data. Run LDA analysis first.
viz.pyldavisNotAvailable: pyLDAvis not available. Please install pyLDAvis package.
viz.pyldavisSvgNotAvailable: SVG export not available for pyLDAvis
viz.similarityMatrixSubtitle: Topic Similarity Matrix Based on Keywords

ldaDynamic.title: Dynamic Topic Analysis
ldaDynamic.nrBinsHelp: Number of time periods for analysis. Leave empty for auto.
ldaDynamic.noDateData: No date metadata found in selected texts
ldaDynamic.info: Dynamic analysis will track how topics evolve over time periods based on document dates.
ldaDynamic.heatmapSubtitle: Topic Similarity Matrix Based on Keywords

lsa.title: LSA Topic Modeling
lsa.info: LSA (Latent Semantic Analysis) uses SVD to discover latent semantic structure in document collections
lsa.optimizeDesc: Test different topic numbers to find the optimal value based on explained variance.
lsa.optimizeProgress: Testing different topic numbers. This may take a while.

viz.noData: No visualization data. Run LSA analysis first.
viz.individualCumulativeByTopic: Individual and Cumulative Variance by Topic

nmf.title: NMF Topic Modeling
nmf.info: NMF (Non-negative Matrix Factorization) discovers non-negative topic components from document-term matrix
nmf.optimizeDesc: Test different topic numbers to find the optimal value based on reconstruction error (lower is better).
nmf.optimizeProgress: Testing different topic numbers. This may take a while.

viz.noData: No visualization data. Run NMF analysis first.

settings.title: Settings
settings.ollamaConnectionFailed: Failed to connect to Ollama. Make sure Ollama is running.
settings.ollamaHelpText: Ollama allows you to run large language models locally. Please ensure Ollama is installed and running before connecting. Visit ollama.ai to download.
settings.connectionFailedMessage: Connection failed. Please ensure Ollama is running.
settings.customWallpaperDesc: Upload a custom wallpaper as the application background. The wallpaper will automatically fit the window size.
settings.factoryResetDescription: Reset the application to its initial state. This will permanently delete all data.
settings.factoryResetWarning: This action cannot be undone. All corpora, texts, annotations and database records will be permanently deleted.
settings.factoryResetConfirmText: You are about to reset the application to factory settings. This will permanently delete:
settings.databaseRecordsDesc: All corpus metadata, text entries, tags and processing tasks
settings.corpusFilesDesc: All uploaded text files, audio files, video files and transcription files
settings.annotationArchivesDesc: All saved annotation sessions and archives
settings.annotationFrameworksDesc: Reset all frameworks to factory defaults (user-created frameworks will be deleted)
settings.typeResetToConfirm: Type RESET to confirm this action

usas.title: USAS Semantic Tagging
usas.description: Configure priority semantic domains for each text type. The selected text type during corpus upload determines which priority domains are used for disambiguation.
usas.priorityHelp: Domains listed here will be preferred during word sense disambiguation.
usas.noPriority: No priority domains configured. Click "Configure" to add.
usas.textTypeConfigHelp: Configure priority domains for each text type. The text type selected during corpus upload determines which priority domains are used for USAS disambiguation.
usas.noCustomTypes: No custom text types yet. They will be added automatically when you select "Custom" during corpus upload.

categories.H: Architecture, Buildings, Houses And The Home

usasMode.title: USAS Tagging Mode
usasMode.description: Select the method for semantic domain tagging. Different modes have different advantages.
usasMode.ruleBasedDesc: Uses PyMUSAS rule-based tagger with discourse domain recognition and one-sense-per-discourse rules. Supports Multi-Word Expression (MWE) identification.
usasMode.neuralDesc: Uses PyMUSAS Neural model for direct prediction, outputting a single tag per word. Does not support MWE, but provides higher coverage.
usasMode.hybridDesc: Uses rule-based tagging first, then neural network for unknown words (Z99), followed by disambiguation rules. Combines advantages of both methods.
usasMode.loadError: Failed to load tagging mode status
usasMode.modeUnavailable: This mode is not available. Please ensure the neural model is installed.

dictionary.title: Dictionary
dictionary.inputToSearch: Enter a word and click search

common.networkError: Network error. Please ensure the backend server is running.

syntax.constituencyOnly: Constituency parsing currently only supports English
